com.revolsys.gis.cs.projection
Class TransverseMercator

java.lang.Object
  com.revolsys.gis.cs.projection.TransverseMercator
All Implemented Interfaces:
CoordinatesProjection
public class TransverseMercator
extends Object
implements CoordinatesProjection

An implementation of the Transverse Mercator projection. See section 1.3.5 of OGP Surveying and Positioning Guidance Note number 7, part 2.

Author:
Paul Austin

Method Detail

inverse

public void inverse(Coordinates from,
                    Coordinates to)
Project the projected coordinates in metres to lon/lat ordinates in degrees. 
 ϕ = ϕ1 – (ν1 * tanϕ1 / ρ1 ) * [
   D ˆ 2/2 –
   (5 + 3 * T1 + 10 * C1 – 4 * C1 ˆ 2 – 9 * e' ˆ 2) * D ˆ 4 / 24 +
   (61 + 90 * T1 + 298 * C1 + 45 * T1 ˆ 2 – 252 * e' ˆ 2 – 3 * C1 ˆ 2) * D ˆ 6 / 720
 ]
 λ = λO + [
   D –
   (1 + 2 * T1 + C1) * D ˆ 3 / 6 +
   (5 – 2 * C1 + 28 * T1 –
   3 * C1 ˆ 2 + 8 * e' ˆ 2 + 24 * T1 ˆ 2) * D ˆ 5 / 120
 ] / cosϕ1
 
 ν1 = a /(1 – e ˆ 2 * sinϕ1 ˆ 2) ˆ 0.5
 ρ1 = a * (1 – e ˆ 2) / (1 – e ˆ 2 * sinϕ1 ˆ 2) ˆ 1.5
 
 ϕ1 = μ1 +
   (3 * e1 / 2 – 27 * e1 ˆ 3 /32 + .....) * sin(2 * μ1) +
   (21 * e1 ˆ 2 / 16 – 55 * e1 ˆ 4 / 32 + ....) * sin(4 * μ1) +
   (151 * e1 ˆ 3 / 96 + .....) * sin(6 * μ1) +
   (1097 * e1 ˆ 4 / 512 – ....) * sin(8 * μ1) +
   ......
   
 e1 = [1 – (1 – e ˆ 2) ˆ 0.5] / [1 + (1 – e ˆ 2) ˆ 0.5]
 μ1 = M1 / [a * (1 – e ˆ 2 / 4 – 3 * e ˆ 4 / 64 – 5 * e ˆ 6 / 256 – ....)]
 M1 = MO + (y – y0) / k0
 T1 = tanϕ1 ˆ 2
 C1 = e' ˆ 2 * cosϕ1 ˆ 2
 e' ˆ 2 = e ˆ 2 / (1 – e ˆ 2)
 D = (x – x0) / (ν1 * kO)

Specified by:
inverse in interface CoordinatesProjection
Parameters:
from - The ordinates to convert.
to - The ordinates to write the converted ordinates to.

project

public void project(Coordinates from,
                    Coordinates to)
Project the lon/lat ordinates in degrees to projected coordinates in metres. 
 x = x0 + kO * ν * [
   A + (1 – T + C) * A ˆ 3 / 6 +
   (5 – 18 * T + T ˆ 2 + 72 *C – 58 *e' ˆ 2 ) * A ˆ 5 / 120
 ]
 y = y0 + kO * { M – MO + ν * tanϕ * [
   A ˆ 2 / 2 +
   (5 – T + 9 * C + 4 * C ˆ 2) * A ˆ 4 / 24 +
   (61 – 58 * T + T ˆ 2 + 600 * C – 330 * e' ˆ 2 ) * A ˆ 6 / 720
 ]}
 
 T = tanϕ * 2
 C = e ˆ 2 * cosϕ ˆ 2 / (1 – e ˆ 2)
 A = (λ – λO) * cosϕ
 ν = a / (1 – e ˆ 2 * sinϕ ˆ 2) ˆ 0.5

Specified by:
project in interface CoordinatesProjection
Parameters:
from - The ordinates to convert.
to - The ordinates to write the converted ordinates to.
